history.content:
You should be able to waitlist a class with a conflict but only if you are not already enrolled in the other class. You can be waitlisted for two conflicting classes and then get into one of the two as the waitlist processes but if you are already enrolled in one then you are unable through calcentral to waitlist another. Have you seen our CS enrollment policies here and in the pinned announcements? I'm not sure if you're trying to take an upper- or lower-division class, but keep in mind, if you waitlist an upper-div and are not declared CS, you will be dropped from the waitlist in about a month. You can waitlist starting Phase II.

In terms of your other question, I would think you could swap a waitlisted class for an enrolled class that has a time conflict, but the swap is complicated and I don't fully understand it. Some more info here: http://sis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/swap.pdf.

You should be able to waitlist a class with a conflict. Have you seen our CS enrollment policies here and in the pinned announcements? I'm not sure if you're trying to take an upper- or lower-division class, but keep in mind, if you waitlist an upper-div and are not declared CS, you will be dropped from the waitlist in about a month. You can waitlist starting Phase II.

In terms of your other question, I would think you could swap a waitlisted class for an enrolled class that has a time conflict, but the swap is complicated and I don't fully understand it. Some more info here: http://sis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/swap.pdf.

children.subject:
If you read other threads on this piazza page, you will see that non-CS/EECS majors waitlisted for upper div cs classes will be purged from those waitlists at the end of phase 1 so what you suggest isn't worth doing now.

Once it is close to your phase 2 appointment slot, reach out to Cindy Conners (csconners@berkeley.edu) and you can talk then about what classes look plausible versus impossible to imagine non-major enrollment based on data from phase 1 enrollments and budget at that time.
@Michael-David Sasson So that means that I would have to drop the class that I am currently enrolled in to be able to get on the waitlist of the CS course that I plan on taking?

history.content: Does anyone know if I can waitlist a class which has a conflict with a class that I am currently enrolled in? Also, if I am allowed to do that, can I swap the waitlisted class for the current class just before adjustment period so I do not lose my waitlist position. I am not a CS major, but want to take a CS course.
history.subject: Waitlisting a Conflicting Course
